name: Beginner Kettlebell Full Body Workout
description: A beginner-friendly full-body workout using one kettlebell to build strength and muscle at home. Four compound exercises, 4 rounds each. Great starting point for kettlebell training.

exercises.name: Kettlebell Clean and Squat
exercises.description: Clean the kettlebell with both hands from the ground to the rack position at the chest, then perform a squat by lowering until thighs are parallel to the ground and stand back up.
exercises.notes: Explosive clean, controlled squat; breathe out on the way up.

exercises.name: Suitcase Deadlift
exercises.description: Hold the kettlebell in one hand at your side like a suitcase, hinge at the hips to lower the weight toward the ground while keeping your back straight, then stand up by driving through the heels.
exercises.notes: 10 reps per side; keep core tight to avoid leaning.

exercises.name: Alternating Bent Over Row
exercises.description: Hinge at the hips with a flat back, row the kettlebell to your side alternating sides, pulling the elbow back while keeping the body stable.
exercises.notes: 10 reps per side; squeeze shoulder blades at the top.

exercises.name: Feet Elevated Pushup
exercises.description: Place feet on the kettlebell for elevation, perform pushups by lowering the chest to the ground and pressing back up.
exercises.notes: Keep body in a straight line; modify on knees if needed.

circuit.notes: Reps vary by exercise: 8 for clean/squat, 10/side for deadlift and row, 12 total for pushups. Circuit or straight sets both work.

raw.caption:
One of the best beginner kettlebell workouts out there.

If you only have one kettlebell and want to start building strength and muscle from home this is a solid place to start.

Link in bio for the Beginner Program.

#kettlebell #workout
raw.visualSummary: Muscular trainer demonstrates each exercise outdoors on a rubber mat with a black kettlebell, showing proper form for cleans, deadlifts, rows, and elevated pushups.
